The system in operation hitherto has been that in some country districts the farmers, either themselves or through their organizations, have built farmers' stores. Some States have also built storages in the country, butthere is little internal storage in the States under the control of the Government, and the main storage of wheat in Australia is of the crudest and most inexpensive kind possible.
